intro: Urvillea laevis f. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy urvillea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its specific epithet "pubescens." Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. This species is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
